News.Title: GVK Power Board Meeting Set for February 13, 2026
News.Summary: GVK Power & Infrastructure Limited has scheduled a board meeting on February 13, 2026, to consider and approve unaudited financial results for Q3FY26 and nine months ended December 31, 2025.

News.Title: GVK Power Infrastructure Reports Rs 1,038 Crore Loss Amid Ongoing Insolvency Process
News.Summary: GVK Power Infrastructure Limited posted a consolidated net loss of Rs 1,378 crore for the half-year ended September 30, 2025, while operating under Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process since July 2024. The company faces significant financial distress with liabilities exceeding assets, multiple subsidiary deconsolidations, and admitted creditor claims of Rs 15,945 crore against total claims of Rs 21,792 crore.

News.Title: GVK Power and Infrastructure Schedules 22nd Committee of Creditors Meeting During Insolvency Process
News.Summary: GVK Power and Infrastructure Ltd, currently undergoing Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process (CIRP), has scheduled its twenty-second Committee of Creditors (COC) meeting for November 12, 2025 at 3:30 PM IST through online mode. The meeting will provide updates on the resolution process of the corporate debtor. The company informed BSE and NSE about this development as part of regulatory compliance requirements.

News.Title: GVK Power & Infrastructure Reports Quarterly Results Amid Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process
News.Summary: GVK Power & Infrastructure Limited announced unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, approved by the board on August 13, 2025. The company is currently under Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process (CIRP) following NCLT order dated July 12, 2024. The Resolution Professional has received claims worth Rs. 21,79,248 lakhs from financial creditors and admitted claims of Rs. 15,94,489 lakhs for CIRP purposes. The company has accumulated losses and liabilities exceeding assets, with various loan accounts classified as non-performing by lenders. Multiple subsidiaries including GVK Energy Limited and GVK Transportation Private Limited have also been admitted into CIRP. The company has provided guarantees for GVK Coal Developers (Singapore) totaling USD 1,132.45 million. Two resolution plans were rejected by the Committee of Creditors as non-compliant, and the CoC has resolved to re-initiate the CIRP process based on asset-wise sale approach.

News.Title: RDB Infrastructure and Power Reports Strong Q1 Growth with Net Profit Rising to 27M Rupees
News.Summary: RDB Infrastructure and Power reported Q1 net profit of 27 million rupees, representing significant growth from 9.5 million rupees in the same period last year. The company's revenue surged to 675 million rupees compared to 307 million rupees year-over-year. EBITDA increased to 25 million rupees from 12.2 million rupees, though the EBITDA margin slightly declined to 3.70% from 3.97% in the previous year.

News.Title: GVK Power Releases Provisional List of 13 Bidders for Assets Under Insolvency Process
News.Summary: GVK Power and Infrastructure Ltd has published a provisional list of Prospective Resolution Applicants for its assets under the Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process. The company received expressions of interest for five categories of assets, including the company as a whole and specific shareholdings in subsidiaries. Jindal Power Limited and Hindustan Thermalprojects Ltd have applied for all asset categories. Other notable bidders include Adani Airport Holdings Limited for the 1.75% stake in GVK Airport Developers Limited, JSW Projects Limited for the 100% shareholding in GVK Perambalur SEZ Private Limited, and various companies for other asset categories. The list includes 13 prospective applicants total and remains subject to clarifications from bidders. Objections to the provisional list can be submitted until July 30, 2025.

News.Title: GVK Power & Infrastructure Reports Improved Q3 Financial Performance
News.Summary: GVK Power & Infrastructure Limited has announced its financial results for the third quarter. The company's EBITDA (Earnings Before Interest, Taxes, Depreciation, and Amortization) increased to 1.15 billion rupees, up from 980 million rupees in the same quarter of the previous year. Additionally, the EBITDA margin improved to 80.43% from 72.77% year-over-year, indicating enhanced operational efficiency.

News.Title: GVK Power & Infrastructure Reports Reduced Q3 Loss
News.Summary: GVK Power & Infrastructure Limited has reported a consolidated net loss of 141 million rupees for the third quarter, showing a significant improvement from the 592 million rupee loss in the same period last year. The company's revenue slightly increased to 1.4 billion rupees from 1.3 billion rupees year-over-year.

News.Title: GVK Power Releases List of Prospective Resolution Applicants
News.Summary: GVK Power has released a list of prospective resolution applicants for the company. The list includes major players in the energy sector such as Vedanta, Jindal Power, Shyam SEL and Power, JSW Energy, and Zeal Global Opportunities. This development suggests that GVK Power is likely undergoing a resolution process, possibly due to financial difficulties.
